Sentencas: The crystal structure, thermal expansion behavior and electrical conductivity of Nd1-xSrxMnO3+/-delta (x = 0-0.5) perovskite oxides were investigated The chemical compatibility of the compositions with 40 and 50 mol% Sr with Gd2O3 doped CeO2 (CGO) electrolyte was also studied.
Titulo: Characterization of Nd1-xSrxMnO3±δ SOFC cathode materials

Sentencas: An orthorhombic GdFeO3-type symmetry (space group Pbnm, z=4) was identified for all perovskite oxides, and the lattice parameters were determined.
Titulo: Characterization of Nd1-xSrxMnO3±δ SOFC cathode materials

Sentencas: As the level of Sr doping increases, the pseudo-cubic lattice constant decreases, and the thermal expansion coefficient increases.
Titulo: Characterization of Nd1-xSrxMnO3±δ SOFC cathode materials

Sentencas: The electrical conductivity can be described by the small polaron hopping conductivity model.
Titulo: Characterization of Nd1-xSrxMnO3±δ SOFC cathode materials

Sentencas: The conductivity increases on increasing Sr doping, while the activation energy decreases.
Titulo: Characterization of Nd1-xSrxMnO3±δ SOFC cathode materials

Sentencas: The compositions with 40 and 50 mol% Sr show very good thermal expansion and chemical compatibility with CGO electrolyte and can be considered as candidate intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell cathode materials.
Titulo: Characterization of Nd1-xSrxMnO3±δ SOFC cathode materials
Characterization of Nd1-xSrxMnO3±δ SOFC cathode materials
